availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John A. Turner (Grant County, KY, farmer and merchant)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Hutchinson Turner in Pendleton County on January 27, 1841. Father of John J. Turner, Nancy Turner, William Turner, Lucinda Turner, Franklin Turner, Thomas Turner, and Charles Turner. Farmer in Grant County in 1850. Merchant in Grant County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Grant County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 312B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Unknown District, p. 836.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 1.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000272805, p. 218 and film no. 000272800, p. 447.
